item.title: Functional and flexible shell scripting tricks
item.description: Shell scripts vs python or perl Its 2019 now, who writes shell scripts anymore? Am I right? Well, apparently I do. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ There are some good arguments for that here and here which mainly revolve around 2 things: Shell exists in all Unix systems and makes use of system default features. Shell is an “interactive command function” designed to get user inputs during the process of running them. Also, here’s an additional relevant reading about the differences between sh and bash.
